intro: Thermopsis rigida, commonly known as rigid thermopsis, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit, narrow leaves, and showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry, rocky habitats. Thermopsis rigida is also noted for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
